item.title: OpenThermo: Customizable Thermostat for Furnace Control
item.author: Nathan Petersen
item.description: Replace the old thermostat in your living space with a new fully customizable version that allows you to tweak the control algorithms used to keep the temperature comfortable. This article details the design of a custom thermostat device for use in simple on/off furnace systems. It is called “OpenThermo” since it has been released as an open-source project (see the official GitHub project). OpenThermo fully assembled circuit board." OpenThermo fully assembled circuit board.

item.title: AMDC REV D Hardware
item.author: Nathan Petersen
item.description: Advanced Motor Drive Controller, Revision D fully assembled" Advanced Motor Drive Controller, Revision D fully assembled The fourth hardware design revision (REV D) of the Advanced Motor Drive Controller (AMDC) from the Severson Research Group marks a huge step improvement in quality of design, physical size reduction, and functionality compared to previous designs. Background About 2.5 years ago, I begin work on the Advanced Motor Drive Controller (AMDC), an open-source project designed for academic research in motor drives.

item.title: AMDC: Advanced Motor Drive Controller
item.author: Nathan Petersen
item.description: Background My involvement in this project, the Advanced Motor Drive Controller (AMDC), happened because of my undergraduate Independent Study project done at UW-Madison during Spring 2018, advised by Prof. Eric Severson and affiliated with WEMPEC. How did I get this opportunity? Eric, a relatively new professor, was looking for interested students to work on his projects. My name was recommended to him by other professors, so he reached out to me and I accepted the offer.
